posts.author: anthonium
posts.text: Pixel 6 - Camera bar discoloration?:

posts.author: anthonium
posts.text: I just received my Pixel 6 today and notice that on the bottom left of the camera bar where it meets the edge of the device there appears to be a discoloration or slightly unfinished end (see arrow pointing in picture). I thought this was chipped or something but I see the same thing on the other side of the camera bar. It somewhat gives the impression of an unfinished product. I'm kind of OCD about these things.

posts.author: nelamvr6
posts.text: Can't see anything on mine. But then again mine is inside a case...

posts.author: bkdodger2
posts.text: It's hard to see from the pic. Maybe if you can upload a video we might be able to see it a little bit better?

posts.author: anthonium
posts.text: It you have the 6, check the same circled area. Follow the line of the bottom border of the camera bar down to where it meets the sides of the phone. You might see what I'm talking about. It's like the metal looks unfinished.

posts.author: Smokeaire01
posts.text: The camera bar looks just fine on my Pixel 6 Pro.

posts.author: ezdoit
posts.text: OK on mine too

posts.author: anthonium
posts.text: Now I'm wondering if there's something wrong with the paint/finish on mine. Oddly it's on both sides of the camera bar where the bottom line border meets the edges of the phone. Maybe under brighter light you can see it better. I'll try to take another picture.

posts.author: anthonium
posts.text: How about now? Can you guys see what I am talking about? It's on both sides of the phone.

posts.author: straygator
posts.text: It appears to me that there's a small band at the top and bottom where the camera bar is joined to the body of the phone that is simply a slightly different texture and color -- like the lighter gray horizontal band on the phone body located at the midpoint of the camera bar. The reflected light tends to exaggerate the difference in tone, but it doesn't look "discolored" to me.

posts.author: anthonium
posts.text: Yes they appear on the top as well. I am curious to know if others see it on their Pixel. Considering it's uniform I can live with it but it definitely looks unfinished.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Just got the phone , I'm not looking for any flaws until a month

posts.author: anthonium
posts.text: CONGRATS!!! You finally got it!

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Yes , finally

posts.author: anthonium
posts.text: You can end this thread. It's actually normal and is on all devices. Even shows up on official photos of the device before it was released.

posts.author: Av3da
posts.text: Should I upgrade from my Pixel 2 XL ?:

posts.author: Av3da
posts.text: Hi all,

posts.author: Lubna
posts.text: I have gone from 2 XL to 4 XL.

posts.author: Mike Dee
posts.text: If you normally have access to charging battery life is not much of a concern if any at all. If you can wait a bit there might black Friday deals. I recall last year some that pre-ordered were disappointed that the didn't wait.

posts.author: pappy35
posts.text: I just got my 4XL and came from a 2XL. With my usage (the biggest variable) my 2XL ended each day with about 10%-15%. So far the 4XL ended its first full day with 31% (I don't charge during the day at all, ever). Assuming your experience will be the same, the battery life is better (not accounting for 2 years of battery degradation mind you). The phone is, to me, better in every way and I'm happy that I got it. Take that for what it's worth.

posts.author: ezdoit
posts.text: Last years BF deal - Pixel 3. Pretty sure the BF Pixel 2 deal was the same.

posts.author: Kizzy Catwoman
posts.text: I upgraded 2XL to 4XL and no regrets. I usually keep 2 phones so my P2XL is now my second phone. I left all my banking apps on that so that I can use the fps with them.

posts.author: cbreze
posts.text: I used to upgrade every year just to keep up with all the new innovations. Not seeing enough innovating to entice me these days. My pixel 2 still runs as new so can’t justify the cost. Also, really not into all the gesturing navigation required. My pixel 2’s battery Also lasts all day and then some. I can easily hang till next year then I’ll take another look. Plus, and a biggie for me is a finger print reader. I hope that comes back next year.

posts.author: almath
posts.text: Is anyone going to convince you yay or nay??

posts.author: Av3da
posts.text: Well... Seeing the responses here is making me more convinced I should upgrade. I am in a situation where I can buy the pixel 4 almost for free as I have vouchers to spend... I just need to figure out if I should spend some extra cash for the XL or not.

posts.author: aecgda
posts.text: You should upgrade. Excellent phone.

posts.author: Even4steven
posts.text: I upgraded from the 2 XL to the 4 XL Phone is great, battery life is awesome, face unlock is a better way to go, feels great in the hand, much more more fluid.Screen brightness and colors are big upgrade over the 2 XL

data.title: Should I upgrade from my Pixel 2 XL ?
data.author: Av3da

posts.author: fauxsherrr
posts.text: New Pixel 4 XL is glitching?:

posts.author: fauxsherrr
posts.text: I have always been a pixel user, purchased an Lg v6 thinq and it glitched often. Pages in chrome would freeze frequently. I'd push the tabs button and the screen would stay put. Same thing with Facebook, it would appear that I actually pushed the button and that it was going to respond but it would stay frozen on the same page. Now I have a Google Pixel 4 XL and it keeps doing the same things. My pixel 3A XL never had this problem. It seems like it's a lot faster but it's actually not with all the freezing that it does.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: You try clearing cache and force stop chrome?

posts.author: fauxsherrr
posts.text: Thanks, I did create an account. I did those things and it still is performing like that. It's almost like it's so fast it trips over itself and freezes.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Hi, welcome !

posts.author: Lepa79
posts.text: Mine glitches like crazy when I have it connected to my car and Android auto running. It like stutters constantly. My pixel 3 XL never did that.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Something up with AA

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Welcome to Android Central! Does this happen in Safe Mode as well?

posts.author: firebirder
posts.text: I've had similar issues with Chrome since installing the June 5 security patch. I've found hitting the home button then reopening Chrome appears to reset the page, which then should work. I believe this to be more of a Chrome issue with the patch as everything else works fine.

opinion.text: It seems like it's a lot faster but it's actually not with all the freezing that it does
stay frozen on the same page

posts.author: Super Spartan
posts.text: Great, so maybe it'll be released this coming Monday.

posts.author: bhatech

posts.author: HeatedMoon
posts.text: Pixel upgrade:

posts.author: HeatedMoon
posts.text: I have a Pixel 1 and would love to upgrade, but the lack of headphone jack is a little off-putting. I do not desire to spend extra money to get a bluetooth headset that will not get used often. I don't use the headset much but it sure is nice when I need to.

posts.author: Mike Dee
posts.text: They include a set of wired earbuds that use the USB C port or use what you have with the adapter... it works great

posts.author: HeatedMoon
posts.text: But then what happens when the USB C jack wears out from all the use?

posts.author: jimbo1mcm
posts.text: They don't wear out

posts.author: Ziich47
posts.text: You just said you don't use it often so i doubt a couple more plug one won't be that big a deal. These orders are designed to be more robust and durable than older usb. There is a video where Linus tests the durability of usb c if your interested. If you are truly worried you might wear or the port in a couple years, use wireless charging or get the protection plan.

posts.author: Mike Dee
posts.text: It hasn't been a issue that I'm aware of.

posts.author: anon(10534352)
posts.text: May be we are not going to be using headphones while charging as often than we think. I think the dongle should suffice. well, that is if we are carrying one with our headphones always I guess.

posts.author: TheJastrom
posts.text: I thought the same thing about Headphones when I bought the Pixel 2 Xl but I bought some bluetooth earbuds and have never looked back. Plus Bluetooth earbuds are cheaper than ever before, purchase a cheap pair and give it a try.

posts.author: Coop61
posts.text: I've been without a head phone jack for the last 2 years with the Droid Z. It's really not a big deal. I have Bluetooth ear buds all the time. When they are being charged I plug in regular head phones with the dongle. Only time it could have been a real issue is if you need to charge the phone and listen to music at the same time , cant happen. Pixel 3 solved it with wireless charging .

posts.author: vzwuser76
posts.text: I can speak about the USB C jack, but my nephew had a couple phones where the charging port failed due to a lot of use. Granted that was a microUSB port, and maybe the USB C port is stouter, but anything can wear out with time and use.

posts.author: Tomster88
posts.text: Pixel 6 pro $200 off:

posts.author: Tomster88
posts.text: Hey guys,

posts.author: bkeaver
posts.text: Personally I really like my p6 pro, but I'd wait for the 7 if I'm honest. It should have hardware improvements that is kind of needed. Like better efficiency of Cu and better FPS.

posts.author: drvier8
posts.text: Knowing what I know now, I'd wait to see if the 7 has a better FPS and modem. My two biggest complaints. I will be replacing my 6 with either a 7 (after waiting for reviews this time) or something else. I will not keep the 6 past November.

posts.author: Tomster88
posts.text: Thanks for the input. Those are very good points! I do like that the phone is 200 bucks off, I think it makes it very appealing. But maybe I should wait.

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Counterpoint -- I love my 6 Pro and would heartily endorse it. FPS has been totally fine for me, and the telephoto and wide angle lenses are absolutely killer! Battery life is also impressive (but as I've mentioned in other threads, I keep 5G off since T-Mobile's 5G is not great in my area, and this helps improve battery overall).

posts.author: Tomster88
posts.text: Thanks for this. I would def shut off the 5G if I got the phone.

posts.author: drvier8
posts.text: Try it, but I suggest testing it heavily during your return period. If it works for you in your situation great. But if something is off, return it. It will not get better (at least for hardware based issues).

posts.author: patruns
posts.text: I would also add you can still get the 24 month 0% financing in the Google Store. That and $200 off sounds like the best deal you are likely going to see. Also, both Pixel 6s get 3 years of Android updates and now 5 years of security updates. Who knows if Google will offer that again on the Pixel 7.

posts.author: straygator7
posts.text: I bought my Pixel 6 Pro at the end of April, when Best Buy discounted the price by $200. At the time, I also faced the dilemma of whether to await the release of the Pixel 7 in the fall; but I was running out of storage space in my Pixel 5, and we were preparing to leave for a 3-week trip through Europe -- where I customarily takes hundreds of photos. So, encouraged by the reports of others here that many of the initial bugs with the Pixel 6 Pro had been resolved, I took the plunge while the price was advantageous. (I've also found that waiting 4-6 months after the release date has advantages, in allowing an opportunity for Google to repair some early glitches and in the availability of price discounts.)

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Another thing is pixel 7 wont have 200 off like your getting with pixel 6 so take that in consideration as you save some money if you dont need the latest

posts.author: Tomster88
posts.text: Thank you for the input

posts.author: Tomster88
posts.text: Yeah I thought about that too. And the biggest negative when I finally do upgrade will be losing my free photo backup from the 4xl. Thank you everyone for your responses!

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: It takes a little adjustment, but I finally got over the loss of the unlimited Google Photos backups.

posts.author: J Dubbs
posts.text: For me the magic number is $300 or more off

posts.author: Wonka1951
posts.text: Pixel 6 Pro overheating:

posts.author: Wonka1951
posts.text: My Pixel 2 XL always worked fine, my 4a5G overheated when I had it, and my 6 Pro overheats way too often. Was taping some action at our county fair and had to stop because it got hot. Same happened with 4a5G. Never had the problem with my 2 XL. Any ideas?

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Try turning 5g off

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: What was the outdoor temperature when you were filming? Considering the heatwave much of the US is experiencing (apologies if you live somewhere else besides the US), it's possible for any phone to heat up significantly in the outdoors when doing some processor-intensive task (since it's harder to dissipate the heat efficiently).

posts.author: J Dubbs
posts.text: The new phones are packing much faster hardware, with much higher definition video recording capabilities, into the same basic phone sized packages as previous phones. It seems like all the newer higher end phones are showing more heat issues. The industry might have to focus more on cooling technology to keep up with the faster hardware. And passive cooling doesn't seem to be cutting it.

posts.author: Morty2264
posts.text: That conversation at the end of your post sounds like something that will soon happen! I'm picturing those little mini fans attached to the back of one's phone, like a sort of Moto Mod.

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: All good points! I think fans will remain with gaming phones only. More likely, CPU manufacturers (or phone manufacturers themselves like Apple and Google) will continue to work on chips that are more energy efficient. This usually means less powerful chips, but as technology continues to advance, I would expect ultra-low power CPUs to be just as fast as the current top-of-the-line Snapdragon or Apple CPUs within a couple of years.

posts.author: jmadero
posts.text: Pixel 6 Pro "UC" Turning Off and Off Repeatedly (dozens/minute):

posts.author: jmadero
posts.text: Hi All,

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Welcome to AC!

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Welcome to Android Central! Are you on T-Mobile, or another carrier? I think 5G UC is T-Mobile's terminology, but I'm not sure if any other carriers use it as well.

posts.author: jmadero
posts.text: Hi!

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Hi, ok try the network reset and see if it fixes it .

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: T-Mobile's 5G UC encompasses both midband and mm-wave 5G. Mm-wave is the one that's the fastest but has trouble penetrating buildings. I'm not sure if there's an app that can tell you which kind of 5G the phone is connecting with, so it might be worth calling T-Mobile support and asking them if the 5G network where your office is located is midband or mm-wave.

data.title: Pixel 6 Pro "UC" Turning Off and Off Repeatedly (dozens/minute)
data.author: jmadero

posts.author: Super Spartan
posts.text: Is there a way to take portrait/cinematic videos on the Pixel 6 Pro?:

posts.author: Super Spartan
posts.text: I love this phone's camera so much every time I look at other cameras I realize how good the Pixel's post processing is. One thing I wish I could do though is to be able to take portrait/cinematic videos like the iPhone 13 Pro/VIVO x80 Pro/S22 Ultra

posts.author: Super Spartan
posts.text: Also, other than those 3 phones I mentioned, is there any other smartphone nowadays that has this feature?

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: No, there's no portrait mode for videos. It's one of the things Apple touts -- iPhones have always been stronger when it comes to video, but I think Pixels surpassed iPhones in terms of photo quality a while ago.

posts.author: srgonu
posts.text: Sony Xperia can do portrait video. It is based on pure photography skills and no dependency on computational photography. If you are in to it, you will enjoy it.

posts.author: Mathrania
posts.text: S22 can do portrait videos

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Thanks for the input -- I'm curious what you mean by "pure photography skills"? Do you mean that it's based on the lenses that the phone has? Or does it depend on the user's knowledge on how to shoot the subject to achieve proper depth of field?

posts.author: srgonu
posts.text: I meant manual controls. With sony we have to work with fps, shutter speed manual zoom range etc to get the output we want. There is no AI involved. I have Xperia 1 iii as my back up device and my main camera is Sony A7C. Am very comfortable with Sony interface for videos and photos as they are similar but am not much in to videos.

data.title: Is there a way to take portrait/cinematic videos on the Pixel 6 Pro?
data.author: Super Spartan

posts.text: Pixel 6 Ring & Text Volume:

posts.author: Android Central Question
posts.text: Why did Google tie both the ringer and text notification volumes together? I turn off my text volume and leave the ringer volume on when sleeping. Now that the volumes are combined it's a pain to schedule/rule what I want to do during my sleep hours. Are there any 3rd party apps that will allow me to control both volumes separately?

posts.author: matyou98
posts.text: Pixel 7 pro getting warm:

posts.author: matyou98
posts.text: Trying to determine if my 7 pro heating up is normal. My wife took a photo and then went through about every filter available. Probably 2 minutes of applying every filter. When I got the phone back it was medium warm on a scale of low, medium, or hot. My case was that warm. Might have felt hot without a case.

posts.author: DanielLoreti
posts.text: Mine was running very warm for a while, but I was transferring everything over and updating/installing apps and using the camera all at the same time. It's running cooler now.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Yeah probably the whole setting up process

posts.author: TheAngryToaster
posts.text: I could have cooked a medium rare steak on mine while I set it up and transferred everything over and updated it haha

posts.author: matyou98
posts.text: Phone setup completed in the afternoon, this happened in the evening. When applying filters the image has to process. Doing this for every filter one after the other caused my phone to get pretty warm. Wanted to see if that happens to anyone else or not.

posts.author: Stanley Kubrick
posts.text: While mine got slightly hot, or warmer than just warm, during setup most phones will do this. But one thing I have noticed is that after the phone gets "hot" it cools down very quickly! I can only assume this has to do with the added thermal tape I saw on a tear down video.

opinion.text: could have cooked a medium rare steak

posts.author: klau25
posts.text: Pixel setup still showing after setup is finished:

posts.author: klau25
posts.text: Anyone else experiencing the same thing? I actually reset the phone twice last night after I finished setting it up the first time because the setup screen I attached wasn't progressing. It's stuck syncing Google contacts. After I reset it the second time last night, the setup is still showing today. It just keeps coming back even if I forced close the app. I'm pretty sure it's related to my contact app since it keeps saying "trouble syncing, waiting to try again" (screenshot attached)

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Is it only syncing contacts from your Google Contacts in the cloud, or are there any other accounts?

posts.author: klau25
posts.text: Only Google

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Try clear data for play store app then force stop it

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Go to your Google Contacts on your computer browser and see if there are any Samsung contacts (like customer service) that might have been synced to your cloud. if so, try deleting those, in case they're causing some kind of wonkiness.

posts.author: Coop61
posts.text: When Mine was updating last night it hung up on Chrome Beta.It chugged away on that for a couple hours while I had it on the charger not paying attention. Not sure if you're using Beta or not but at least its a suggestion.

posts.author: klau25
posts.text: Thank you everyone for your response. I think I solved the issue. I backed up my contacts locally. Deleted the entire contacts after. Reboot the phone and then restored it. That seems to solve my issue!

data.title: Pixel setup still showing after setup is finished
data.author: klau25

posts.author: Android Central Question
posts.text: Pixel 6 phone and keyboard lagging:

posts.author: Android Central Question
posts.text: My pixel 6 and the keyboard are lagging. I have turned the phone on and off again. I have uninstalled and reinstalled gboard. I have done a soft and hard reset and it's still terribly slow to the point I can't type messages as it keeps zooming in on the keyboard. Has anyone else had this issue?

posts.author: Kizzy Catwoman
posts.text: No. I haven't. When did this start happening to you?

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Welcome to Android Central! Does this also happen in Safe Mode?

posts.author: toniomadsma
posts.text: Did you ever find a resolution? Having same issue.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Welcome to AC !

posts.author: toniomadsma
posts.text: I am; still having same issue. Closed all running apps, deleted saved text messages (this used to work when I had this issue on previous models), system reset recently completed, at 32% memory capacity, don't have a lot of apps installed

posts.author: toniomadsma
posts.text: Thanks so much for your reply! Have the security patch. May have solved the prob tho by turning off magnification under accessibility. Fingers crossed this takes care of it!

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Thats great

posts.author: Morty2264
posts.text: Keep us posted on what happens!

posts.author: Dave Pyle
posts.text: I had the same problem, the fix seems to be simple.. This lagging only happens when the screen magnifier is in the small box mode. Open the magnifier and select the whole page setting in the bottom right of the screen.

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Welcome to Android Central. and thanks for the tip!

posts.author: robtani
posts.text: Can you turn off the 5G in Pixel 4a 5G:

posts.author: robtani
posts.text: Hi there,

posts.author: haris163
posts.text: Yes, dial *#*#4636#*#* (copy paste might not work), then select Phone Information and you can select a network combination without 5G (shown as NR).

posts.author: hallux
posts.text: I have 5G enabled on mine and have been getting GREAT battery life. I wouldn't be horribly concerned about it.

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: See if you can select LTE instead of 5G in the Network Mode menu:

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: What Carrier you on ? My TMO pixel 5 has the option

posts.author: hallux
posts.text: Oddly enough, not an option on Fi...

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Oh wow, you don't even get these menus

posts.author: haris163
posts.text: I don't have them either. I am on AT&T.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: been awhile since I had my Att sim in the pixel , but think your right .

posts.author: Mike Dee
posts.text: Every carrier is different

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Yes

posts.author: Rukbat
posts.text: And coverage is different - you may be in a 5G area and not have any 4G coverage. So if you turn 5G off and lose service, that's why. (Eventually 5G will be used for voice and text and no one will have any 4G equipment on the towers. The same thing happened when we finally got 2G ... that's with the dodos now [in the US].)

posts.text: Hi, I just tried doing this to turn off 5g on my google pixel 4a5g:

posts.text: Not sure about AT&T. In the UK I just selected 4G under network options.

posts.author: haris163
posts.text: I also have AT&T and my plan doesn't have 5G so I selected LTE/WCDMA which should cover both flavors of 4G plus 3G.

posts.author: DanielLoreti
posts.text: Really interested in Pixel Pro. How versatile and capable is the camera?:

posts.author: DanielLoreti
posts.text: I'm use to Galaxy Ultra, which has big Megapixel counts, quad lenses, huge zoom. I worry about losing a lens and going to triple cam instead of quad and I worry about 50MP compared to 108MP and 100x zoom down to 30x zoom. How versatile and capable is Pixel Pro camera?

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: I've had great results with my Pixel 6 Pro. The telephoto is excellent (although there's no way for me to directly compare with Samsung's). Here are some recent samples:

posts.author: DanielLoreti
posts.text: Thanks! How's the stock camera app? Are there a lot of modes like portrait, slow mo, food, etc?

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: The Pixel Camera app has never been big on lots of different modes, since Google emphasizes computational photography for real appearances. There's Portrait, Night Sight, Astrophotography, Panorama, Photosphere, and Motion (which allows for a short video that can include motion blur effects).

posts.author: The_Woo
posts.text: Point and shoot....Natural looking photos.... Action photos.....Pixel is the best IMO.

posts.author: DanielLoreti
posts.text: How's pets and moving objects?

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Generally very good. I usually don't take shots of quickly moving subjects, but when I have, the results are typically good. The Top Shot feature also gives you the opportunity to choose a different frame that might be in better focus.

data.title: Really interested in Pixel Pro. How versatile and capable is the camera?
data.author: DanielLoreti

aspect.text: take shots of quickly moving subjects

posts.author: jcdub
posts.text: Pixel 6 pro vs regular pixel 7:

posts.author: jcdub
posts.text: Can anyone answer my quandary. I'm looking at a second-hand pixel 6 Pro versus a new pixel 7. Which would you choose and why?

posts.author: o4liberty
posts.text: With the trade in offer Google has now I would go new if you have a trade in.

posts.author: swrk4643
posts.text: I can tell you I came from the 6 Pro to the 7 and I have been _very_ pleased. I did not have any of the issues with the 6 Pro other than a dropped phone and cracked screen... but was looking for just a tad bit smaller phone. The 7 is just that device. I still have all of the features that I liked with the 6 Pro in a smaller package. (I assume you are asking about the 6 Pro -vs- the standard 7).

posts.author: fuzzylumpkin
posts.text: Personally, I'd go for the 7, but that's not necessarily what I'd recommend for everyone.

posts.author: jcdub
posts.text: I am indeed looking at the 6 pro vs the normal 7.

posts.author: fuzzylumpkin
posts.text: You've got a 6? Then I'd change my answer to neither.

posts.author: Morty2264
posts.text: I think if you're not in need of a second-generation Tensor chip, the latest camera tech, and still want a really wonderful phone, the Pixel 6 Pro would be an excellent choice! Even brand-new, the phone is much more economically friendly now!

posts.author: srgonu
posts.text: I had heating and signal issues on my 6pro and upgraded to 7pro. Though it gets little warm to touch, not like 6pro and no signal dropping issues now. Really like the face unlock and telephoto camera. If you are having any of the issues I mentioned, it is worth the upgrade.

posts.author: mxmarcus
posts.text: Go for 7, I have P6P and took advantage of T-Mobile deal. I am very happy with P7P, much better than P6P

posts.author: jcdub
posts.text: Didn't go for the 6 pro in the end. Going to get a pixel 7. My pixel 6 has poor battery life and gets hot on regular occasion. I don't think I could wait for the pixel 8. But I'll most likely get the pixel 8 Pro next year

posts.author: the3maples
posts.text: Rattling sound around camera bar on Pixel 7 pro…:

posts.author: the3maples
posts.text: Hi everybody,

posts.author: HyperM3
posts.text: Yes, this was common on the P6P also. It's the optical camera lens moving.

posts.author: the3maples
posts.text: Thank you @

posts.author: L0n3N1nja
posts.text: Most phones do this now because they have optical image stabilization, the camera module moves to counter shake in a human hand to prevent blur and allow longer shutter speeds. When the camera isn't in use there is no power to it so it shakes around freely and creates a rattle like sound.

posts.author: the3maples
posts.text: Thank you @

posts.author: L0n3N1nja
posts.text: Kind of surprised by that to be honest, last few Samsung phones I've had rattle and numerous other phones as well.

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Welcome to Android Central! I think it was such a common question to Samsung support that they made a dedicated help page about it:

posts.author: dookie.
posts.text: Never noticed it before, but sure as shine...mine rattles.

posts.author: the3maples
posts.text: Thank you @ B. Diddy for the link!

posts.author: J Dubbs
posts.text: Yep the free included Mariachi band is all part of the pixel experience

posts.author: tacrites
posts.text: Popup on bottom of Pixel 3 XL screen:

posts.author: tacrites
posts.text: Some apps either while in the app or when I leave the app put a pop up on the bottom of my Pixel 3 XL phone screen. Screenshot below show the screen after I left an application. This pop up times out after awhile but sometime gets in the way of typing. Does anyone know how to turn off this option?

posts.author: Javier P
posts.text: There's no easy way to remove that toast, you'll probably need root to do it. The time it stays on the screen can be changed in 'Time to take action' in the Accessibility settings. See which option you have selected.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: I agree with javier

posts.author: tacrites
posts.text: Well that sucks. :-/ Seems kind of crazy there isn't an option to turn that off. Especially since sometime it pops up and covers the space bar of my keyboard when I want to type. I can type through the 'toast', but it does cover my space bar and I have to guess where to tap.

posts.author: Javier P
posts.text: Those toast messages have been around for a long time. Many apps use them for different kinds on notifications, even error messages. For example, the app I use for this forum (ACF) shows them every time I mark a thread as read.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: I like to see options to be able turn it off in accessibility in future, you can set delay but not off .

data.title: Popup on bottom of Pixel 3 XL screen
data.author: tacrites

posts.author: jesunik
posts.text: Google Pixel 4A issue:

posts.author: jesunik
posts.text: Hello! I'm a Google pixel 4A user, recently I had disabled few Google apps because I was not using them.

posts.author: swebb
posts.text: Do you recall which apps?

posts.author: jesunik
posts.text: Yes. Google drive, Google photos and YouTube.

posts.author: belodion
posts.text: Welcome as a new member.

posts.author: jesunik
posts.text: Thank you for welcoming me.

posts.author: J Dubbs
posts.text: Re-enable them then reset your app preferences... then restart for good measure. Google designs their apps to work together... it's not usually a good idea to start disabling them without a little research. If you want to limit what information Google collects about you your best bet is to use a de-googled phone. An internet search will tell you more about that

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Welcome to Android Central! Can you show us a screenshot of the horizontal line that appears when you try to add a shortcut to the homescreen?

posts.text: I’m baaaaack. From iPhone 11 Pro Max back to Pixel 4XL. Good choice this late in the game?:

posts.author: KillerQ
posts.text: Go from iPhone 11 Pro Max - back to the Pixel 4XL?

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Welcome back

posts.author: almath
posts.text: The four of us missed you..

posts.author: almath
posts.text: The 7 of us still with the 4XL missed you..

posts.author: J Dubbs
posts.text: And so did the 2 of us still using the pixel 3 and 3XL

posts.author: almath
posts.text: My post weren't showing up and I thought it was the gifs I was using..

posts.author: Tomster88
posts.text: I just sold my 4 XL and upgraded to Pixel 6 Pro. The 4 XL is a great phone. There are things about it I definitely miss, including the squeeze feature, face ID, and unlimited photo storage. Enjoy!

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: They show up ok now. I actually merged your posts together.

posts.author: almath
posts.text: Ok, thank you!

posts.author: Morty2264
posts.text: Welcome back to the green land if Android! Hey, if the Pixel 4 XL is what you want -- go for it! The Pixel 7 will be launched in likely two months (OH, BOY!), so you won't have long to wait if your plan is to use the 4 XL until then. Glad you're happy to be back!

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: Can't use Twitter on my Pixel 4 after Android 13 update:

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: Some time after my Pixel 4 received the Android 13 update, I stopped being able to use the Twitter app. Twitter does come up, but basically freezes after an initial screen comes up (see attachment).

posts.author: rvbfan
posts.text: Nevermind, I should read the whole post.

posts.author: Javier P
posts.text: You are not alone, other users have experienced the same problem after September security patch and Twitter are aware of the problem. There's a workaround that worked for many people though. Turn notifications ON and see if it makes any difference.

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: My wife's Pixel 5 had this problem. It seemed to be solved by clearing the app cache and data in

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: Turning notifications on resolved the issue. Thank you for the assist!

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: Thank you for the suggestion. I tried doing this before turning on notifications but even after a forced stop and restart the problem persisted.

posts.author: Javier P
posts.text: Excellent! Glad it helped and thanks for the follow up. See you around the forums.

data.title: Can't use Twitter on my Pixel 4 after Android 13 update
data.author: Paul Mena

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: How long should I hold on to my Pixel 4?:

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: I've had my Pixel 4 for nearly 3 years and it's been quite solid. I haven't seen a need to get something newer, but the price of the Pixel 6a is pretty attractive. The fact that it's 5G-enabled is a big plus, but Cape Cod has been very slow to roll out 5G, and it still not available where I live. Is there any other compelling reason to retire it before it stops receiving Android updates (rumored to be no earlier than October 2022)?

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: The 6a will still be around later this year, and you'll also be able to see how the Pixel 7 looks as well. So why not hold onto the 4 for now?

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: I agree that the Pixel 7 might be worth waiting for. Perhaps Google will have Cyber Monday sales similar to the one that prompted me to buy the Pixel 4!

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Another thing to keep in mind is that if you really like Face Unlock, the Pixel 6 line is still waiting for that feature to be added. And it still won't be as secure as the Pixel 4's Face Unlock, due to the latter's Soli chip.

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: I didn't realize the Pixel 6 line didn't support face unlock. Initially I thought it was a fad, but once I got used to it I found it both secure and convenient. When we all started having to wear masks I would have to remind myself that it wouldn't recognize me!

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Yeah, Face Unlock is an ongoing saga with the Pixel 6:

posts.author: anon(50597)
posts.text: 5g doesn't mean squat.

posts.author: ben55124
posts.text: Google store has been offering good trade in deals on older pixels towards a P6a. They offered me $250 for a P4a5g with a cracked screen. May be tempting if they continue those offers on P7.

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: Google Fi is offering $100 off the Pixel 7, which has the facial recognition that has eluded the Pixel 6. Part of me is leaning toward a Samsung Galaxy S22 because I can cast it to my Samsung TV, but it's more expensive than the Pixel 7 - for now. Am I patient enough to wait for Cyber Monday deals?

posts.author: JSOL1
posts.text: This is the first time I've pre-ordered a phone, especially given the 6s issues, however $300 trade in for my 4 was irresistible. rolling the dice I know

posts.author: ben55124
posts.text: P4xl 128gb = $325 credit towards P7 (+$100 google store credit), so time to jump for me. Noticed the P3XL would still get $275 so may be another year of good trade-in value for the P4 towards a P8.

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: It makes me wonder if my Nexus 6P would fetch anything as a trade-in, since I still have it collecting dust on a shelf.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Lol.. is it a option on the list?

posts.author: Paul Mena
posts.text: I haven't checked if it's even a trade-in option, but I will when it comes time to trade in the Pixel 4. "Have I got a deal for you..."

posts.author: ben55124
posts.text: Battery health on my p4xl has dropped significantly in last few months. More motivation to take the p7 upgrade offer. Condolences to whoever ends up with my trade in.

data.title: How long should I hold on to my Pixel 4?
data.author: Paul Mena

posts.author: joshkrupinsky
posts.text: Google Pixel At a Glance bug keeps removing weather from home screen widget:

posts.author: joshkrupinsky
posts.text: I have a Google Pixel 5. After couple of hours being in Airplane mode, the weather disappears from the home/lock screens, not that I need it that much but still it should work. Any ways to fix this?

posts.author: Morty2264
posts.text: Hi! Hmm, that seems like a bothersome glitch! Is your Pixel 5 updated to the lastest software? The June software update seems to be out for most places now! What about your weather app?

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: [Moved to pixel 5 forum]

posts.author: rvbfan
posts.text: Airplane mode turns off all data I believe, the weather app requires a data connection. Now are you saying that when you turn airplane mode off it doesn't come back?

posts.author: joshkrupinsky
posts.text: no, it doesn't. It only comes back if I restart the phone or turn it on (the weather I mean) manually. I mean it has to do with Google app because when I uninstalled the updates and reinstalled them back, the weather appeared right away. But the question is how to make it stay when using Airplane Mode.

posts.author: rvbfan
posts.text: I don't think it will stay, as I said, weather app requires a data connection.

data.title: Google Pixel At a Glance bug keeps removing weather from home screen widget
data.author: joshkrupinsky

posts.author: mustang7757

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: I didn't know this budget phone had a Ip67 rating, that's pretty cool not many budget phones have this.

posts.author: Laura Knotek
posts.text: That's something I didn't know either. That's really great for the price.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: It is

posts.author: sulla1965
posts.text: I can vouch for the 6a water resistance. I got caught in a downpour. It was in my pocket, but got drenched just the same. Phone didn't skip a beat.

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Awesome

posts.author: OhAlfie
posts.text: no it doesn't

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Thanks

posts.author: IMANUT46
posts.text: Amazon and Pixel 6:

posts.author: IMANUT46
posts.text: Although I've been a loyal customer of Verizon for 20 years, our relationship with their Company Store has soured substantially. My wife and I both have phones bought from them and our Carrier is Verizon.

posts.author: ras47
posts.text: Usually it comes down to financing and future upgrade deals. With the Pixel lineup you skip the ISP-branded bloatware that traditionally came with a Carrier-branded phone. There is no difference in phones now. It's all about the price these days.

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: The major possible difference could be lack of mmWave 5G antenna. The Verizon variant does have mmWave, while the unlocked variant does not. This only matters if you care about mmWave 5G (which is available mostly in metro areas) -- it's really fast, but doesn't have good range and gets physically blocked easily. Verizon has other kinds of 5G that aren't as fast, but will work with the unlocked Pixel 6.

posts.author: diesel97
posts.text: Check Best Buy out they had the Pixel 6 $299

posts.author: swebb
posts.text: One of the differences I've not seen mentioned is the activation process. You will leave the VZ store with an operating phone, while Amazon is totally on you. Self-activation is supposed to be simple, but you never know.

posts.author: drvier8
posts.text: I had the Droid Maxx way back in the day from Verizon and got a SIM with it. I then bought a Nexus 5x, Pixel 2, Pixel 4, and my current Pixel 6 directly from Googles (so unlocked) and have just moved that SIM from one phone to the next.

posts.author: J Dubbs
posts.text: Yep I love my physical SIM cards... been using the same card since my Moto X Pure Edition on AT&T problem free. I doubt it'll be that easy when everything goes ESIM

posts.author: maxmin
posts.text: Pixel Phones. Too Many Compromises.:

posts.author: maxmin
posts.text: I have been using a Pixel 5a I received as a promotional item for a couple months. I have to say I am pretty disappointed in the phone and the Pixel implementation of Android 13 overall. I guess I thought would share my experiences if somebody is considering a Pixel. I am coming from a One Plus 7t which overall worked pretty well.

posts.author: Golfdriver97
posts.text: My first thought is to try turning off 5G. See if that helps with the connectivity.

posts.author: J Dubbs
posts.text: Sounds like it's time to try Samsung... you have to find the phone that works for you

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: Google has never really focused on dual SIM devices -- I would agree that there are probably better devices out there for dual SIM function, from manufacturers who have dealt with this for longer (like Samsung).

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: [Moved this from Pixel 6 Forum to pixel 5a]

posts.author: mustang7757
posts.text: Maybe your experience would differ on higher end Pixel?

posts.author: patruns
posts.text: "The Fire Stick incompatibility has to do with lack of Miracast support on Pixels. I'm not sure if the decision to remove Miracast support was a business decision (to focus on Chromecast) or a technical decision."

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: I'm pretty sure that just casts to Chromecast. If you have a TV or dongle that supports only Miracast, give it a try, but I don't think it'll work. (I don't have any Miracast devices, so I can't test it -- but from all that I've read, Pixels don't support it.)

posts.author: TheGoodNamesAreGone
posts.text: Found my pixel 2XL:

posts.author: TheGoodNamesAreGone
posts.text: Somehow over the course of the year after I got a S20 and I COULD NOT find my pixel 2 XL no matter what. However, I did some extensive car cleaning and found it wedged in between one if the back seats. Ss long as it had been, I wasn't counting on it to power back on. But to my surprise it did, and it has updated to Android 11.

posts.author: B. Diddy
posts.text: You could also get pretty good trade-in value for that for a Pixel 4a 5G:

posts.author: TheGoodNamesAreGone
posts.text: I decided to check battery health by downloading accubattery since it has been a while since use. First result was 75 % now. It's up to 84%. Are these battery health apps inaccurate or does it take them time to learn the true status of your battery?

posts.author: TheGoodNamesAreGone
posts.text: Yeah I thought about it, but even with the discount, that's still money I'll need for other things right now. I'm pretty pleased with my 2 XL even though it's at the end of it's software life. Really impressed by how the camera still performs and keyboard still works fantastic. I'll probably split time between this and my S20 as my daily drivers.

posts.author: TheGoodNamesAreGone
posts.text: I did some speed testing with the browsers and opening some apps between my pixel 2xl and s20. Pixel 2xl actually beat my s20 out several times. I think the advantage is still with the S20 on that front, but it was a close margin. I'd say 6-4 in favor of the S20 in that test. Pixel 2 XL is mighty impressive for a 3 year old device to hang that that tight with a 2020 flagship samsung.

posts.author: TheGoodNamesAreGone
posts.text: One thing I'm also finding out is my pixel 2 XL is also much better at stand by time than my s20. My pixel 2 XL stays at virtually the same charge level if I don't use it. Whereas my S20 will lose 10-12% in the same amount of standby time.

opinion.text: much better at stand by time
